content.description: [NOTE: I'm sure this traverse has been done 100 times already, but it seemed like worth noting. If this has another name or if anyone knows the first ascensionist, I'm happy to update it!]Begin with a stand start at the arete using obvious good holds (there are a few options, none of which really change the experience). Traverse left following the best, most obvious jugs along the main seam. Continue ascending gradually, avoiding topping out until the far left side of the boulder, up the finish of Phat Lip. Nothing classic, but decent movement and a solid warmup for the harder problems.
content.protection: A spotter with a pad would be wise for those not 100% solid at V0/V1. A fall from up high could land you on the retaining wall in a few spots.
content.location: Right to left traverse beginning on the main arete and ending up the finish of Phat Lip.

content.description: Sit start on the stairs to fun slab on top.

Starting again same as Recliner V6 sitting with hands matched on side pulls and feet out right. Reach out right to a good square hold and go up and left reaching for the jug to top out. The side pull out right of the jug is not on (per NYC Climbing, Gaz Leah).
content.location: Start same as Recliner V6 in the middle of the south face on the leftward trending flake sitting with hands matched on side pulls.

content.description: Using the middle flake on on the south face (used in recliner and fridge) and the west facing wall for the chimney start, work your feet and hands upwards. A series of undercling thumb catches can stabilize you as you work to the horizontal crack, at about 2/3 the way up the south face. Using the high arrete, top out to its left.
content.protection: Using a crash pad is never a bad idea
content.location: Chimney start between the obvious flake on the south facing wall (used in recliner and fridge) and the west facing wall.

content.description: Not a well known classic of the city like Polish Traverse or Family Values but just as good quality a line! Start sitting with hands matched on side pulls low on the obvious flake on the south face. With feet out right move up the flake on side pulls and move up to a jug with the left hand then to the top and top out. Avoid anything out left or right of the flake and the jug. Problem isn't too high for a crash pad to be necessary but still recommended. Part of this face is oftentimes a little wet but usually all of the holds on this problem and the rest of the problems on this boulder are dry.
content.protection: Crash pad recommended as always but not entirely necessary
content.location: Start sitting on side pulls on the obvious leftward trending flake in the middle of the south face with feet out right.

content.description: Sit start near the left base of the West Face and climb up to the obvious lip (ledge) and traverse left all the way along it before topping out
content.location: Left-most climb of the West Face

content.description: Link up of traverse from far left of westface (overhanging lip of Phat Lip), around the arete, and the Fridge top out. Crux is at the arete where you have to turn from the west face around the arete to throw to the vertical flake of The Fridge.
content.protection: Pad for top out is always comforting.
content.location: Start with hands as high up the overhanging lip of Phat Lip as you can reach (far left of west face). Traverse right towards the arete using obvious hand and feet holds. Turn the corner around the arete and throw out to the vertical flake of The Fridge. Top out of Fridge per normal.

content.description: Climb direct through the lip from the same sit start as Phat Lip
content.location: Same sit start as Phat Lip on the left end of the West Face

content.description: Climb just left of the arête but don't use it!
content.location: Just left of the arête on the West Face

content.description: [NOTE: I'm sure this traverse has been done 100 times already, but it seemed like worth noting. If this has another name or if anyone knows the first ascensionist, I'm happy to update it!] Begin on any of several good holds near the right arete on the west face. This line traverses left along obvious good jugs. Once you come to the large breakage where Upper West heads up, stay on the lower jug line over into Phat Lip.
content.protection: If you're planning on topping out, spotter with a pad at the left arete would be wise for those not 100% solid at V0/V1. A fall from up high could land you on the retaining wall in a few spots.
content.location: Right to left traverse beginning on the main arete and traversing into the lower section of Phat Lip, finishing up the left arete.

content.description: Climb direct from a sit start on the south face hugging the arete and the flake out right. Move up the arete and the flake to top out. You will need to throw a right heel hook on the flake after moving up some.
content.location: Start sitting while hugging the arete and the flake on the south face.

content.description: Sit start beneath the blast hole and use the blast hole to climb straight up.
content.location: Look for the blast holes (unnatural cylinder shape) towards the left of the West Face

content.description: An eliminate of Recliner V6. Start on the same leftward trending flake on the south face sitting with hands matched on side pulls and feet out right. Move up the flake and avoid the good jug and instead utilize the vertical side pull out right to top out. Crash pad recommended.
content.location: Start same as recliner on the obvious leftward trending flake on the south face sitting with hands matched on side pulls and feet out right.

content.description: Start beneath a blast hole and climb straight up through the choss
content.location: Look for the blast hole (unnatural cylinder) higher up and to the right of the Blasted Thing blast hole(s)

content.description: Sit start at the base of B-Right and make a big(ish) move out right to a good hold then top out direct.
content.location: Sit start beneath B-Right blast hole

content.description: Sit start at the base of the arête and climb up it! (Sit start may feel quite hard for the tall)
content.location: The obvious arête at the corner of the West and South faces

content.description: A cropping of rock right over the median off of Central Park West and 103rd street. Very close to Worthless Boulder and Shit Rock. The West face facing the street is mostly V0 problems but the south face near the end of the rock has some worthwhile problems ranging from V1-V8.
